pipeline package¶

Subpackages¶

  • pipeline.models package
    • Submodules
    • pipeline.models.time module

Submodules¶

pipeline.decorators module¶

Reusable decorators for the pipeline.

pipeline.decorators.config(parameter_name: str, key: str)¶

Satisfies a parameter with a value from config.yml

pipeline.decorators.last_stage(parameter: str)¶

Satisfies a parameter with the last stage executed of the pipeline.

pipeline.decorators.stage(parameter: str)¶

Satisfies a parameter with the last stage executed which is an instance of the mixin type.

pipeline.factory module¶

Factory function used to wrap a function with zero parameters.

pipeline.factory.factory(function: Callable, *args: any, **kwargs)¶

Wraps a function, passing args and kwargs to it. Returns a wrapper with 0 parameters.

pipeline.initializer module¶

Intializes classes, satisfying configuration and supplied parameters.

pipeline.initializer.initializer(function: Callable, parameters_dict: Dict[str, any])¶

Intializes classes, satisfying configuration and supplied parameters.

pipeline.serial module¶

Implements a serial pipeline.

class pipeline.serial.Serial(name: str, *stage_types: List[Callable])¶

Bases: pipeline.stage.Stage

A serial pipeline which can be used as a stage to provide a logical unit.

execute() → pipeline.stage_result.StageResult¶

Executes all stages in this pipeline sequentially.

flowchart()¶

Generates a chart that represents this pipeline.

get_time() → pipeline.models.time.Time¶

Calculates the average time per execution of this stage.

static_stages = []¶

pipeline.stage module¶

Provides a super class for stages of a pipeline.

class pipeline.stage.Stage¶

Bases: abc.ABC

A stage of a pipeline.

after_execute()¶

Executed after the execute method.

before_execute()¶

Executed before the execute method.

abstract execute() → pipeline.stage_result.StageResult¶

When implemented in a child class, processes the provided state and returns a new state.

flowchart()¶

Generates a flowchart for the current stage.

get_time() → pipeline.models.time.Time¶

Calculates the average time per execution of this stage.

pipeline.stage_result module¶

Contains a result of a stage execution.

class pipeline.stage_result.StageResult(continue_pipeline: bool, next_stage: bool)¶

Bases: object

Contains a result of a stage execution.
